intro: Ozoroa viridis, commonly known as the green ozoroa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and appear in clusters. Ozoroa viridis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
